title: CrediTrust AI
subtitle: Credit acceptance prediction platform for PNC Bank
description: Credit acceptance prediction platform developed for PNC Bank's AIS SCLC 2025 challenge.
overview: An AI-powered credit decision platform that predicts loan acceptance rates with over 70% accuracy, developed as part of the AIS 2025 Fintech challenge.
highlights: Achieved over 70% prediction accuracy on random test sets
Contender for the AIS 2025 Fintech challenge
Integrated machine learning with financial data analysis
Created intuitive web interface for credit assessment
challenges: Meeting PNC Bank's regulatory compliance requirements
outcomes: Built comprehensive credit risk assessment tool
Recognition as AIS 2025 Fintech challenge contender
Platform ready for real-world deployment scenarios
results: Contender for the AIS 2025 Fintech challenge. Prediction model was just over 70% accurate when testing against a random test set.

title: Freelance Music
subtitle: Online music education scheduling platform
description: Platform for teachers to post their music lesson schedule so students can join. A collaborative solution connecting music educators with students through an intuitive scheduling system.
technologies: C#, JavaScript, HTML/CSS, MySQL, ASP.NET Core, Entity Framework
overview: A full-stack web application that streamlines music education by allowing teachers to manage their schedules and students to book lessons effortlessly.
highlights: First-time database hosting success
Successful implementation of Agile Methodology
Client was very satisfied with overall product and architecture of the project
Assignment was given an A+, and was one of two considered to present to the University's advisory board
challenges: Creating real-time schedule updates across user types
Designing user-friendly interface for non-technical teachers
Building scalable database for growing user base
outcomes: Streamlined lesson booking process for students
Teachers given full control of their lessons and payment strategy
Enabled data-driven insights for academy management
Secure data transfer and password management

scrumMaster: Resolved team blockers and improved velocity
dataEngineer: Designed and implemented MySQL database schema
Created data migration and backup procedures

results: Client was satisfied with app outcome, and we got a perfect grade in the course.

title: Revenue Prediction Application
subtitle: Machine learning CLI for bar sales forecasting
description: Command line interface application for predicting daily and weekly sales for a bar in Tuscaloosa, Alabama.
technologies: C#, .NET Core, Gradient Boosting, Machine Learning
overview: A machine learning solution that predicts bar revenue with 98% accuracy by analyzing historical sales data, game day patterns, and betting trends.
highlights: Achieved 98% prediction accuracy (Â±2% error margin)
Won 'Best-Logic Award' in programming challenge
Built custom Gradient Boosting model from scratch
Reduced inventory waste on game days by 15%
challenges: Accounting for Alabama football game day impacts
Creating user-friendly CLI for non-technical staff
outcomes: Optimized staffing schedules based on predictions
Self-improving model that adapts over time
Transformed daily operational decision-making
results: Predicted sales with a maximum of 2% error on real sales

title: Secure Communications App
subtitle: This application was a demo for a Full-stack Business Programming course. Its intent was to showcase one time pads and their unbreakable encryption.
technologies: C#, JavaScript, HTML/CSS, One-Time Pads, AES-256 Encryption
overview: A full-stack web application and command-line interface that allowed a users to create one-time pads, use them and automatically delete them when a message was sent for maximum security.
highlights: Special Forces tested and approved
First time use of Factory Pattern
Users were very satisfied with overall product and architecture of the project
Project was greenlit, and I did not have to take my final exam
challenges: Single use encryption is a difficult concept to conceptualize
Implementation of Device and Server nodes proved to be harder than I expected
Maintenance of Device pads from the server side without communication
outcomes: Special Forces teammates were able to communicate key events in a training scenario effectively
Server-side control of One-Time pads was very effective
Device storage management for smaller-space or more discreet devices achieved
Secure end-to-end encryption for data transfer
results: Client was satisfied with app outcome, and we got a perfect grade in the course.

title: Personal Portfolio Platform
subtitle: React-based developer portfolio with responsive design
description: A modern portfolio website built with React and responsive design principles to showcase my development projects and skills.
technologies: React, JavaScript, CSS, React Router, Lucide Icons, Responsive Design, C#, ASP.NET
overview: A clean, modern portfolio website built from scratch using React with responsive design principles. Features project showcase cards, detailed project pages, bio section with skills overview, and a feedback mechanism for visitors.
highlights: Fully responsive design that works across all device sizes
Interactive project cards with dynamic filtering
Component-based architecture for maintainability
Integrated feedback system for visitor comments
Custom global back button implementation
challenges: Creating a consistent responsive design across all screen sizes
Implementing an efficient project filtering system
Building reusable components that maintain visual consistency

approach.title: Planning
approach.description: Started with wireframes and component hierarchy to establish the structure and user flow of the portfolio

approach.title: Component Architecture
approach.description: Designed reusable components like cards, navigation elements, and layout containers for consistent styling

approach.title: Responsive Framework
approach.description: Built a mobile-first CSS approach with media queries and fluid sizing using clamp() and relative units

approach.title: Data Structure
approach.description: Created JSON data structures for projects and bio information to make content management easier

approach.title: Polish & Refinement
approach.description: Added animations, transitions, and refined the UI based on user feedback and testing

outcomes: Created a professional showcase for development projects and skills
Demonstrated React and front-end development expertise
Built a platform that can be easily updated with new projects
Implemented responsive design principles for all device sizes

features.title: Project Showcase
features.description: Interactive cards with filtering by technology and search functionality

features.title: Detailed Project Pages
features.description: In-depth views of each project with challenges, approach, and outcomes

features.title: Skills Overview
features.description: Visual representation of technical skills with categorized tags

features.title: Feedback System
features.description: Form for visitors to provide ratings and comments on the portfolio

results: Successfully created a responsive portfolio that effectively showcases projects and skills while demonstrating front-end development capabilities.

title: Red Velvet Mafia Forward Operating Base
subtitle: Roblox event practice world
overview: A roblox world complete with several real-world and in-game replicas to mimic realistic movements for the Roblox game: Jailbreak. My game featured a Bugatti Chiron, Tesla Roadster, and an MH-6 Little Bird helicopter.

title: GAP Prediction Modeling
subtitle: Accurate forecasting of Gross Auction Proceeds
description: Developed XGBoost and SARIMAX models to forecast auction proceeds with minimal error.
technologies: Python, XGBoost, SARIMAX, scikit-learn, matplotlib, seaborn
overview: Self-taught Python to build machine learning models predicting Gross Auction Proceeds using historical GAP, CCI, and Lots Sold data.
highlights: ~1% residual error within 5 sigma
XGBoost model incorporating multiple lagged factors
SARIMAX model accounting for company acquisition
challenges: Learning Python and libraries from scratch
Limited historical data for extreme cases
outcomes: Forecast accuracy improved from 90% to ~99%
Established baseline for future predictive analytics
